# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around Hyperfy development and community interactions. A key technical discussion focused on converting Decentraland colliders to Hyperfy rigidbodies via a script, which would eliminate the need to manually modify thousands of GLB files. There was also mention of implementing games like Pong in Hyperfy, with suggestions to create 3D versions with potential VR support. One user inquired about the minimum environment GLB size needed to cover an entire world, receiving the answer that 2km squared reaches the skybox (which has a 1km radius). A community member expressed interest in creating a Mars simulation with Eliza agents to build a virtual city. Overall, the chat demonstrates a collaborative community sharing ideas and technical knowledge while supporting each other's Hyperfy development efforts.

## 2. FAQ
Q: What's the minimum size of environment GLB so that I can cover the whole world? (asked by Cayden0207) A: 2km squared goes all the way up to the skybox, or the skybox is 1km radius (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Has anyone built Mars simulation yet? Can Eliza agents create in worlds yet? (asked by Natefrog) A: Unanswered
